To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. O LORD<S>3068</S>, thou hast searched<S>2713</S> me, and known<S>3045</S> me.
Thou knowest<S>3045</S> my downsitting<S>3427</S> and mine uprising<S>6965</S>, thou understandest<S>995</S> my thought<S>7454</S> afar off<S>7350</S>.
Thou compassest<S>2219</S> my path<S>734</S> and my lying down<S>7252</S>, and art acquainted<S>5532</S> with all my ways<S>1870</S>. <sup>compassest: or, winnowest</sup>
For there is not a word<S>4405</S> in my tongue<S>3956</S>, but, lo, O LORD<S>3068</S>, thou knowest<S>3045</S> it altogether.
Thou hast beset<S>6696</S> me behind<S>268</S> and before<S>6924</S>, and laid<S>7896</S> thine hand<S>3709</S> upon me.
Such knowledge<S>1847</S> is too wonderful<S>6383</S> <S>6383</S> for me; it is high<S>7682</S>, I cannot<S>3201</S> attain unto it.
Whither shall I go<S>3212</S> from thy spirit<S>7307</S>? or whither shall I flee<S>1272</S> from thy presence<S>6440</S>?
If I ascend up<S>5266</S> into heaven<S>8064</S>, thou art there: if I make my bed<S>3331</S> in hell<S>7585</S>, behold, thou art there.
If I take<S>5375</S> the wings<S>3671</S> of the morning<S>7837</S>, and dwell<S>7931</S> in the uttermost parts<S>319</S> of the sea<S>3220</S>;
Even there shall thy hand<S>3027</S> lead<S>5148</S> me, and thy right hand<S>3225</S> shall hold<S>270</S> me.
If I say<S>559</S>, Surely the darkness<S>2822</S> shall cover<S>7779</S> me; even the night<S>3915</S> shall be light<S>216</S> about me<S>1157</S>.
Yea, the darkness<S>2822</S> hideth<S>2821</S> not from thee; but the night<S>3915</S> shineth<S>215</S> as the day<S>3117</S>: the darkness<S>2825</S> and the light<S>219</S> are both alike to thee. <sup>hideth: Heb. darkeneth not</sup> <sup>the darkness and: Heb. as is the darkness, so is the light</sup>
For thou hast possessed<S>7069</S> my reins<S>3629</S>: thou hast covered<S>5526</S> me in my mother's<S>517</S> womb<S>990</S>.
I will praise<S>3034</S> thee; for I am fearfully<S>3372</S> and wonderfully made<S>6395</S>: marvellous<S>6381</S> are thy works<S>4639</S>; and that my soul<S>5315</S> knoweth<S>3045</S> right well<S>3966</S>. <sup>right: Heb. greatly</sup>
My substance<S>6108</S> was not hid<S>3582</S> from thee, when I was made<S>6213</S> in secret<S>5643</S>, and curiously wrought<S>7551</S> in the lowest parts<S>8482</S> of the earth<S>776</S>. <sup>substance: or, strength, or, body</sup>
Thine eyes<S>5869</S> did see<S>7200</S> my substance, yet being unperfect<S>1564</S>; and in thy book<S>5612</S> all my members were written<S>3789</S>, which in continuance<S>3117</S> were fashioned<S>3335</S>, when as yet there was none<S>259</S> of them. <sup>all: Heb. all of them</sup> <sup>which: or, what days they should be fashioned</sup>
How precious<S>3365</S> also are thy thoughts<S>7454</S> unto me, O God<S>410</S>! how great<S>6105</S> is the sum<S>7218</S> of them!
If I should count<S>5608</S> them, they are more in number<S>7235</S> than the sand<S>2344</S>: when I awake<S>6974</S>, I am still<S>5750</S> with thee.
Surely thou wilt slay<S>6991</S> the wicked<S>7563</S>, O God<S>433</S>: depart<S>5493</S> from me therefore, ye bloody<S>1818</S> men<S>582</S>.
For they speak<S>559</S> against thee wickedly<S>4209</S>, and thine enemies<S>6145</S> take<S>5375</S> thy name in vain<S>7723</S>.
Do not I hate<S>8130</S> them, O LORD<S>3068</S>, that hate<S>8130</S> thee? and am not I grieved<S>6962</S> with those that rise up<S>8618</S> against thee?
I hate<S>8130</S> them with perfect<S>8503</S> hatred<S>8135</S>: I count them mine enemies<S>341</S>.
Search<S>2713</S> me, O God<S>410</S>, and know<S>3045</S> my heart<S>3824</S>: try<S>974</S> me, and know<S>3045</S> my thoughts<S>8312</S>:
And see<S>7200</S> if there be any wicked<S>6090</S> way<S>1870</S> in me, and lead<S>5148</S> me in the way<S>1870</S> everlasting<S>5769</S>. <sup>wicked: Heb. way of pain, or, grief</sup>
